title: What to Do During a Flood
steps: Move to higher ground immediately.
Avoid walking or driving through flood waters.
Disconnect electrical appliances if instructed.
Listen to authorities on radio or SMS alerts.

title: Earthquake Safety Guidelines
steps: Drop, Cover, and Hold On until shaking stops.
Stay away from windows and heavy furniture.
After shaking, evacuate the building calmly.
Avoid using elevators.

title: Cyclone Preparedness Instructions
steps: Secure doors, windows, and loose outdoor items.
Stay indoors and avoid going near water bodies.
Keep emergency lights and battery radios ready.
Follow official evacuation orders.

title: Fire Emergency Guidelines
steps: Use stairs, not elevators, to evacuate.
Cover your nose with a cloth to avoid smoke inhalation.
Stop, Drop, and Roll if clothes catch fire.
Call emergency services immediately.

title: Staying Safe During a Heatwave
steps: Stay hydrated and avoid outdoor activities during peak hours.
Wear loose, light-colored clothing.
Use fans or cool showers to lower body temperature.
Check on elderly or ill family members.

title: Landslide Safety Tips
steps: Move away from steep slopes during heavy rain.
Listen to local warnings or geological alerts.
Evacuate immediately if cracks or tilting trees are noticed.
Stay alert to sudden changes in water flow or noise.

title: Basic Emergency Kit Checklist
steps: Drinking water (3 days supply)
Non-perishable food items
Flashlight with extra batteries
First-aid kit and essential medicines
Copies of important documents

title: General Emergency Hotlines
steps: Fire Service: 199
Ambulance: 16263
Police: 999
National Disaster Hotline: 1090
Local Shelter Hotline: 1671

title: Lightning Storm Safety Tips
steps: Seek shelter indoors immediately.
Avoid using electrical appliances or wired phones.
Stay away from windows, doors, and anything metal.
Wait at least 30 minutes after the last thunder before going outside.
